member.name: T:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock
member.summary: Clock which can be constructed with an initial instant, and then advanced programmatically. This class is designed to be used when testing classes which take an as a dependency.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.#ctor(NodaTime.Instant)
member.summary: Creates a stub clock initially set to the given instant.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.Advance(NodaTime.Duration)
member.summary: Advances the clock by the given duration.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.AdvanceDays(System.Int64)
member.summary: Advances the clock by the given number of standard (24-hour) days.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.AdvanceHours(System.Int64)
member.summary: Advances the clock by the given number of hours.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.AdvanceMilliseconds(System.Int64)
member.summary: Advances the clock by the given number of milliseconds.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.AdvanceMinutes(System.Int64)
member.summary: Advances the clock by the given number of minutes.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.AdvanceSeconds(System.Int64)
member.summary: Advances the clock by the given number of seconds.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.AdvanceTicks(System.Int64)
member.summary: Advances the clock by the given number of ticks.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.FromUtc(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a fake clock initially set to midnight of the given year/month/day in UTC in the ISO calendar.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.FromUtc(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a fake clock initially set to the given year/month/day/time in UTC in the ISO calendar.

member.name: P:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.Now
member.summary: Returns the "current time" for this clock. Unlike a normal clock, this property will return the same value from repeated calls until one of the methods to change the time is called.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.StubClock.Reset(NodaTime.Instant)
member.summary: Resets the clock to the given instant.

member.name: T:NodaTime.Testing.TimeZones.SingleTransitionZone
member.summary: Time zone with a single transition between two offsets. This is similar to a precalculated zone with only two intervals and no tail zone, but it's simpler to construct and can be used to test PrecalculatedDateTimeZone.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.TimeZones.SingleTransitionZone.#ctor(NodaTime.Instant,NodaTime.Offset,NodaTime.Offset)
member.summary: Creates a zone with a single transition between two offsets.
member.param: The offset of local time from UTC before the transition.
The offset of local time from UTC before the transition.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.TimeZones.SingleTransitionZone.#ctor(NodaTime.Instant,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a zone with a single transition between two offsets.
member.param: The offset of local time from UTC, in hours, before the transition.
The offset of local time from UTC, in hours, before the transition.

member.name: P:NodaTime.Testing.TimeZones.SingleTransitionZone.EarlyInterval
member.summary: The ZoneInterval for the period before the transition.

member.name: M:NodaTime.Testing.TimeZones.SingleTransitionZone.GetZoneInterval(NodaTime.Instant)
member.summary: Returns the zone interval before or after the transition, based on the instant provided.

member.name: P:NodaTime.Testing.TimeZones.SingleTransitionZone.LateInterval
member.summary: The ZoneInterval for the period after the transition.
